title: Understanding the Problem
text: We need to solve a system of equations using a matrix inverse. Let's start by understanding what a matrix is and how we can use it to represent these equations.

title: Formulating the Matrix
text: The system of equations can be written in matrix form as $$A X=B$$, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables (x and y), and B is the column matrix of constants on the right.

title: Matrix Representation
text: Create the matrix representation of the system. Write down how each equation looks in the matrix form $$A X=B$$.

title: Inverse of a Matrix
text: To solve for X, we need to find the inverse of matrix A. Not all matrices have inverses, but a 2x2 matrix does if its determinant is not zero.

title: Calculating the Determinant
text: The determinant of a 2x2 matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$ is calculated as $$a d-b c$$. We need to find the determinant of matrix A to check if it has an inverse.

title: Compute the Determinant
text: Find the determinant of matrix A $$=$$ $$\begin{bmatrix} 8 & 4 \\ 3 & -4 \end{bmatrix}$$.

title: Finding the Inverse Matrix
text: Since the determinant is not zero, the inverse of a 2x2 matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$ can be calculated using $$1/det(\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix})$$ * $$\begin{bmatrix} d & -b \\ -c & a \end{bmatrix}$$.

title: Apply the Inverse to the System
text: Multiply the inverse matrix by the column matrix B to solve for X. This can be written as $$X=A^{\left(-1\right)} B$$.

title: Compute the Solution
text: Using the inverse matrix, compute the values of $$x$$ and $$y$$ in the equation $$A^{\left(-1\right)} B$$. Please enter your answer in the form (x,y).
